title: Africa: The African Private Sector Summit (APSS) Appoints Professor Kingsley Moghau as Chair of its Advisory Board and Executive Board
description: [The African Private Sector Summit] The Africa Private Sector Summit (APSS), a Pan-African, Private Sector-led Non-Profit organization that promotes Trade and Investment in Africa and is headquartered in Accra, Ghana, has announced the appointment of Professor Kingsley Moghalu of Nigeria, as the new Chairman of its Board of Directors.

title: Africa: China's BRI and Africa's Infrastructure Development Ambitions
Africa: AFCON 2023 Official Match Ball Unveiled
description: [Ghanaian Times] The Confederation of African Football (CAF) on Monday unveiled the official match ball for the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations.

title: Africa: Why Funding African Research Requires a Systems Approach
description: [allAfrica] Dr. Janet Surum has made it her life's goal to study how African learners can use psychological theories and principles to solve their daily life challenges on a continent where many out-of-school youth struggle to secure dignified work and unemployment and underemployment continue to climb. She does this through her teaching and research. But this has not been easy as an African educational psychologist and researcher.

title: Africa: Africa Presses for UN Tax Plan Despite EU Resistance
description: [International Consortium of Investigative Journalists] The United Nations is on the cusp of negotiating an international tax convention to tackle inequality and tax abuse, but transparency advocates say some wealthy countries are "dragging their feet."

title: Africa: Beyond a Cessation of Hostilities, Ethiopia Needs Comprehensive Peace
description: [ISS] Almost a year after signing the Cessation of Hostilities Agreement, Ethiopia is marred in conflict.

title: Africa: Catching Up With Delgres
description: [Afropop] Since we last spoke with Danaë, the band has released two full-length albums, Mo Jodi in 2018 and at 4:00AM in 2021, and are now finishing work on their third album to be released next year. They have also toured the world and developed quite a following. So before their show this year at Nuits d'Afrique, we sat down with them to chat about what's new.

title: Africa: UN General Assembly Should Act On Gaza
description: [HRW] Member States Should Demand Civilian Access to Aid, Act to Prevent Atrocities

title: Africa: Over 114 Million Displaced By War, Violence Worldwide
description: [UN News] More than 114 million people worldwide have been forced to flee their homes in the first nine months of this year due to conflict, persecution and human rights violations, UN refugee agency UNHCR said on Wednesday.

title: Africa: More Action Needed to Advance Women's Role in Global Peace and Security - UN Chief
description: [UN News] Twenty-three years after the adoption of a landmark UN Security Council resolution on women, peace and security, their presence is still woefully lacking at negotiation tables, Secretary-General António Guterres said on Wednesday.

title: Africa: Solidarity Fund Needed for Africa's Sustainability Transitions
description: [Africa Renewal] It is time for Africa to turn a new development page and for the global community to support it

title: Africa: Green Hydrogen - Africa's Chance to Break the Colonial Extractive Dynamic
description: [African Arguments] European countries are, once again, desperate for the continent's resources. Why aren't African governments demanding more in return?

title: Africa: Men Say They Are Spending More Time On Household Chores, and Would Like to Do More
description: [The Conversation Africa] Women perform between three and seven times more caregiving tasks than men in the global south. These include household domestic work and largely focus on caring for children.
